document.title: North Carolina Standard Course of Study for English Language Arts

04DAD783A75246FC9700D40291A5BF01.description: Use words and phrases learned through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

E6948EB9B94E464D99990E19B796FEC5.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

1F56040D77B742719067483E88F657D9.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action by acting out the meanings.

D38BEA0E7E4F423CB8713F14CFD14F38.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

C4CA7D832EE14722B3B2156FDF4DB2EE.description: Sort common objects into categories to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

886C83CD81D74D13936ED516FE5612D5.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore nuances in word meanings.

34FD6F6864734FE0BBAC5D087F13BDC8.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

5FAB72E9129244B59B8A892EA6AAA7B5.description: Determine and/or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content: context clues, word parts, and word relationships.

75012ACBE9C343439DADE000D1CD4A93.description: Determine and/or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, word relationships, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

56DE95B7CF94496DA0FD7063C830C0A7.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

AC588B6E17A649638EAFF93C26A96937.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing; demonstrate proficiency within the K-1 conventions continuum.

062B302905E04C76A3175CD2F29610E7.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

A8569CFE36A04CE38B51352E64DE7981.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking; demonstrate proficiency within the K-1 grammar continuum.

D7588642B7C14D2D9D4268A55A314F55.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

15403BDBFF0D4C378BC67917766E9709.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

D9902A91CE774C49AE7D44B9AAE73265.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

D117F83CF5E64AA59AD6331A1737452C.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

D816AA0AE76F4F03B9D404E89F2A0E85.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

65F7988B45074BE9BC65FA7BB2CCAA37.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

8DB58BA4875348A6AB46A467B6DCE556.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

2CB0F7978E9843F884271F1127E98DFA.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

34ED2D554EB1442AA3FD8268CC9D81FB.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

30B6794B14CE4E3C96EC8A9858E03FB1.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

736CD6CB26574DFAB585A9ED99B50707.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

837A2574CF33468F933377D7C9EFFEC7.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

0170A761DB71474497C9FC632CD5132A.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

E687E18CABA44B2E813195904AB9329D.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

288A89BD9B34473FA2CC87E345C536E1.description: Participate in shared investigation of grade appropriate topics and writing projects.

A7B8303706824E2C9D165C3A079028DF.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

23355183CA874BE282661AABE881B5F2.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing, either in collaboration with peers or in a whole group setting.

BDF3521FC17E41169F4A50AEC1EDBE8C.description: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

CBC9A88E94D54DDE963768A2FBA87F3C.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from adults and/or peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

92C0695719424F6EB4FB78671784C9F1.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and with guidance and support, provide a reaction to what happened.

C4EC6BF32DAF44A5B137BE4C21F696EA.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

2B1E547D8F3E4E7DB42EA8D64E5F045A.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from adults and/or peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

F9EC029B8DD3468FADE0B8E48B180F5D.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

10445DAD595042AF819BA86C42875736.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

53BB1D253E0B47E08634C99FD7C815CF.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from adults and/or peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

B1A6161DF0034050A0A5787A086E3BB7.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book.

91830C612BD849F18E38FB915011DD45.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

AB147A0FB0F24D049A37A0F8C8451F8E.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

F041639DA1134BD98C8DD60F6D246828.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

0A961924D1E54ED9B7749889E321CC92.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight.

393846C96B5642EFA212EBD2CBBEA06A.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

5F34CAFFCE294F4DBD1CB1E0E24C7E1E.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

89435FF5BD2146579F865EB52EE462E3.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

16BD1425CA0F4D078E445F6ACF31C243.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

56DD83F9C0504F13B66FB5FFD1BDEA7D.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

1F4F59D9DF0144D59C563CDE4A2146A1.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

288DCD66B91D47A6A8364452E5FF41F1.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

18EC85B575254256827C82D8C87D0195.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

BCAA12326BB34C3BB3A5A76DB67D652D.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lower-case letters of the alphabet.

4742B49F98C34558A1AF0D3CE09E7632.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

9925D1BB6EA84CD09F8B4B4FB67924A8.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

937ACC5BD91C43BA80D4E24433EE6F85.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

B6ED529272B94075BC477411C5BAD1D7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

8AABD7F567C54867BEF06283005EC8BB.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

CE0A22511EAA40078C0646E56C901E4B.description: Read and understand complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text.

9B19F00FA55E49418DAEE8A83740D494.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic.

ACD6236B21C248A8B68B8A55DD7C0C34.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

94C9AF9BC30D4444BD5023977CDF7CB5.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

9D8A9293DA9F4BCCBC7C01BB37C4E3C3.description: With prompting and support, describe how the words and illustrations work together to provide information.

EE8F910196DD4FE3819857D1EDE2DD6A.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

5E897ED6D4A649C69CC86E0E9EDD5D06.description: With prompting and support, define the role of the author and illustrator in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

E52F208D7C1E4FDF9DC646E811FA002A.description: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

6A6E5D523DEA4C2198A11509880C629E.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

3E9FEFCF490E40528929B1875576BB45.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

DE5CAB39D0F747F499549860B2DBC193.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about words in a text.

E17416431D0D420AB1A4A12A677F67EB.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

F0E0676651BF49BE812E5AD945FDF2B7.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

AD76843A52AF4982A5816A6EB17697DD.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

0AD9FE350C724FE5AD00A27D69F921C2.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

D4D73E6E24AF4902A244A54DFED65C15.description: Determine central ideas (RI) or themes (RL) of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

EFA491101183457C932BEDA666A65D49.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

D4C8D084C6E34AE39FEB94619F5A59F5.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

9A4772A0CF9B4009AD85720C229547C2.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

40C0928FAB3B4967A9FF40F448175AF2.description: Read and understand complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text.

682E3C0A5E1A48AF84796945E2F1D9F2.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

1715DA9CCCB6473A85789129BF74F909.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

F6C8C5DAFC0A4487BE375CDA0734D6D2.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

6E9AAFDD2F22449EB1D2C45D7FBB229C.description: With prompting and support, describe how the words and illustrations work together to tell a story.

79E205F8256249768E589C9488A6D7CA.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

7969A1F7BA2B46FE9922CE1CE45C367F.description: With prompting and support, define the role of the author and illustrator in telling the story.

0600C90F09CC4D7086AB76D24F93B805.description: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

E66AB2A7E39646CE905C92535B38813D.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

BDFF8DB4E1634C90823491FBDDD7D5EE.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about words in a text that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

66D3DA09D76E4FA1AF832906834D3E32.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

157388524A124614942778E483FC0AE1.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

319BF669B7884962A210B17E4741645B.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

E5F252750939488597E5BB09B6A57EAA.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

EC41EE56781F4EA08672F8865D1B4448.description: Determine central ideas (RI) or themes (RL) of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

A14B145D35794F7FB70BC52A04F87A2E.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

9DB02084193D4890A621EAFBE926A35E.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
